basics.name: Ashveed Ashraf
basics.label: Physics Researcher
basics.summary: Physics researcher working at the interface of statistical physics, machine learning, and complex systems, with a focus on large deviation theory, stochastic thermodynamics, and physics-informed machine learning.

education.institution: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER), Thiruvananthapuram

work.name: GITAM University
work.summary: Theoretical and computational modeling of nucleosome unwrapping and chromatin accessibility.
highlights: Developing stochastic and statistical physics models for nucleosome unwrapping
Implemented Grand Canonical Monte Carlo and dynamical systems approaches
Applied stochastic thermodynamics to gene regulation

work.name: Raman Research Institute
work.summary: Inferring interaction potentials from stochastic trajectories using Graph Neural Networks.
highlights: Developed physics-informed GNNs for overdamped Langevin dynamics
Reconstructed Lennard–Jones interaction potentials from trajectory data

work.name: GITAM University
work.summary: Sampling exponentially rare trajectories using large deviation theory.
highlights: Developed Normalizing Flow based one-shot rare trajectory generators
Conditioned volume-preserving transformations on conjugate parameters

projects.name: Quantifying Consensus in Effective Model Inference for Disordered Ising Systems
projects.summary: Theoretical framework for consensus learning in disordered statistical systems.
highlights: Teacher–student setup on 2D disordered Ising models
Studied stability under noisy and limited observations
Invited talk at ICTP–SISSA Spring College on Complex Systems (2026)

projects.name: Atomistic Spin Dynamics Simulations of Skyrmions
projects.summary: Master’s thesis on skyrmion stability in transition metal ultrathin films.
highlights: Quantified effects of DMI, exchange, and anisotropy

publications.name: Dynamical Large Deviation Generators: One-Shot Technique to Sample Exponentially Rare Trajectories
publications.summary: Normalizing Flow based framework to sample rare-event trajectories in stochastic dynamics.

publications.name: Quantifying Consensus in Effective Model Inference for Disordered Ising Systems
publications.summary: Study of robustness and consensus in inferred effective models under disorder.
